japanese: （五つ子の父親が沖縄に来ている）
translation: (The quintuplets' father is in Okinawa.)

japanese:
（その連絡を一花から受けた俺たちは、
　すぐさま集合し、緊急対策会議を開いた）
translation:
(After receiving the news from Ichika,
 we immediately gathered and held an emergency meeting.)

japanese:
（一花の元に来た連絡によると、
　あの人が沖縄に来た理由は
　学会に出席するため、らしい）
translation:
(According to the information that Ichika received,
 it seems that he came to Okinawa
 to attend a conference.)

japanese:
（送られてきたメールには、
　こちらと合流する予定はない、
　と書かれていたが……）
translation:
(Although the email that was sent to us stated
 that he has no plans to meet with us...)

japanese:
（一抹の不安を覚えながら、俺たちは
　四葉の立てたプラン通り、
　明日は首里城に見学へ行くことにした）
translation:
(With a hint of anxiety, we decided
 to follow Yotsuba's plan and go sightseeing
 at Shurijo Castle tomorrow.)

japanese:
（向こうは学会参加だ。
　そうそう出会うことなんてないだろう）
translation:
(Their dad's attending the conference,
 so it's unlikely that we'll run into him.)

japanese: どうですか、上杉さん。
translation: Well, what do you think, Uesugi-san?

japanese: 他人だと思いたいが、無理があるな。
translation:
I want to believe that it's someone else,
but it seems unlikely.

japanese:
実は上杉さんにしか見えてない
幻覚だったりしません？
意識するあまり誰でもお父さんに見えちゃう系の。
translation:
Could it be that it's just a hallucination that only
you can see? Like when you think of something so much
that anyone starts looking like our dad.

japanese: ちょっと確認しておきましょう。
translation: I'll check, just in case.

japanese:
おい、四葉！
リボン！　見えちまうぞ！
translation: Hey, Yotsuba! Your ribbon! He might recognize us!

japanese: はっ！？
translation: HUH?!

japanese: とりあえず戻るぞ。
translation: Let's head back.

japanese: ラジャーです！
translation: Roger that!

japanese: あの人、正殿前の庭から動こうとしてなかったな。
translation:
He doesn't seem to be moving
from the front of the Seiden.

japanese: 誰か待ってるんでしょうか？
translation: Is he waiting for someone?

japanese:
もしかして俺たちだったりしてなー。
はははー。
translation:
Maybe it's us?
Hahaha.

japanese:
まさか、そんなことあるわけないですよー。
あははー。
translation:
Oh come on, that's impossible.
Ahahaha.

japanese:
はあ……。
どうすんだこれ……。
translation:
*sigh*
What are we supposed to do...?

japanese:
あ、戻ってきた！
おーい、ふたりともー！
translation:
Ah, he's back!
Hey, you two!

japanese:
しーっ！
大きな声を出すな！
translation:
SHHHH!
Don't speak so loudly!

japanese:
大丈夫ですよ上杉さん。
さすがに聞こえてないと思います。
translation:
Don't worry, Uesugi-san.
I don't think he heard us.

japanese:
そのリアクションで答えがわかった。
いたんだね、お父さん。
translation:
I can tell from the reaction.
Dad was there.

japanese: こういう悪い予感って大抵当たるのよね。
translation:
The bad feelings about things like this
usually turn out to be true, huh.

japanese: 斥候を放って正解だった。
translation: Sending out scouts was the right choice.

japanese:
ですが、私たちとは合流しない、
という話だったはずでは？
translation: Yet, he said he wouldn't meet up with us, right?

japanese:
実際、向こうから合流はしてないぞ。
もし俺たちと会ったとしても、
それは偶然ってことだ。
translation:
Actually, he didn't come to meet up with us.
Even if we do run into him, it'll be a coincidence.

japanese: 待ち構えてても偶然なの？
translation: Is waiting for him also a coincidence?

japanese: らいはちゃんはそのまま、素直なままでいてね。
translation:
Raiha-chan, please stay the way you are,
honest and straightforward.

japanese: え？　ええ？
translation: Huh? Huhhh?

japanese:
つーかあの人、学会はどうしたんだよ。
こんな所にいる余裕なんてあるのか？
translation:
So, what about his academic conference?
Do they really have the luxury to be here?

japanese: ああ、それなんだけど。
translation: Oh, about that.

japanese:
さすがに都合がよすぎて気になったし、
江端さんに確認してみたんだけど――
translation:
Well, I was suspicious of how convenient this trip was,
so I asked Ebata-san, and%p-2;――

japanese:
お父さんの予定に、
沖縄での学会なんて入ってないって。
translation:
Apparently, there's no academic conference in Okinawa
on Dad's schedule.

japanese:
これは間違いなく、
卒業旅行を見張りに来たってことだね。
translation:
That means he definitely came here
to keep an eye on our graduation trip.

japanese:
し、しかし、旅行の日程を把握してなけりゃ、
今日ここには来れないだろ？
translation:
B-but if he didn't know our itinerary,
how could he have known we'd be here?

japanese: あ。
translation: Ah.

japanese: ……四葉？
translation: ...Yotsuba?

japanese:
今回の旅行のしおり、
お父さんにも渡しちゃってます。
translation: I gave Dad a copy of our trip itinerary.

japanese: なんでだよ……。
translation: Why...?

japanese:
いくら許可をもらってても、
お父さんも心配だろうなって思って。
translation:
Even though we had permission,
I thought that Dad would still be worried.

japanese:
危険なことはしませんから
安心してくださいってつもりで……あはは……。
translation:
I just wanted to let him know
that we won't do anything dangerous
and he can rest easy... Ahaha...

japanese:
推測ですが、恐らくお父さんは
四葉と上杉君の関係を知りたいのだと思います。
translation:
I'm just guessing, but Dad probably wants to know
more about Yotsuba and Uesugi-kun's relationship.
Huh...

japanese:
四葉。
上杉君とのお付き合いについて、
まだお父さんに報告していませんよね？
translation:
Yotsuba.
You haven't told Dad
about your relationship with Uesugi-kun, have you?

japanese: う、うん、してない。
translation: N-no, I haven't.

japanese:
お父さんは、私たちの会話や素振りから、
あなたと四葉が特別な関係であることに
薄々、気付いているのでしょう。
translation:
From our conversations and behavior,
he probably already had a vague idea that
something special is going on between you and Yotsuba.

japanese: ……そうなのか？
translation: ...Is that so?

japanese:
半年前の状況なら
気がつかなかったでしょうけどね。
translation: He probably wouldn't have realized it half a year ago.

japanese:
お父さん、普通にマンションに帰ってくるし、
ご飯を一緒に食べたりもするようになったから。
translation:
But now, he comes home to our apartment
and eats meals with us.

japanese:
（ああ、そうだ。
　卒業旅行を決めた時もそうだったな）
translation:
(Oh, right.
 That also happened when we decided
 on our graduation trip.)

japanese:
（二乃と五月の家出にも
　気がつかなかったような頃からは、
　大きく変わってるってわけか）
translation:
(And since the time when Nino and Itsuki
 ran away from home,
 it seems like he's become much more attentive.)

japanese:
そんな時、突然、沖縄旅行の話などされたら
親としては心配して当然でしょう。
translation:
At times like these, if someone suddenly starts
talking about a trip to Okinawa,
it's only natural for a parent to worry.

japanese: 確かに……。
translation: That's true...

japanese:
（こっちとしては、
　もう少し四葉との関係を深めてから
　正式に報告するつもりだったんだが……）
translation:
(From my perspective, I was planning to deepen my
 relationship with Yotsuba a bit more
 before making a formal confession...)

japanese: しかし、わざわざ沖縄まで来るか？
translation: But why come all the way to Okinawa?

japanese:
それだけ四葉のことを心配してるんだよ。
まあ、色々あったし。
translation:
Because that's how worried he was about Yotsuba.
Well, a lot happened.

japanese: あはは……。
translation: Ahaha...

japanese:
だとしても、お父さんって
こういうことをするタイプだったのね。
意外だわ。
translation:
Even so, Daddy is the type to do things like this, huh.
It's surprising.

japanese:
そうかな？
ご飯の時とか、私たちの話も
聞いてないようでちゃんと聞いててくれるし。
translation:
Is that so?
He listens to us during meals and such,
even though it seems like he's not.

japanese:
（……なんだかんだ言ってるが、
　父親とも上手くやっていけてるんだな）
translation:
(Though they're saying this and that,
 but it sounds like they're getting along well
 with their dad.)

japanese:
でも、これってチャンスじゃないかしら、フー君？
私たちを安心させてくれるんでしょ？
translation:
But isn't this a good chance, Fu-kun?
You'll reassure us, won't you?

japanese:
え？　チャンス？
二乃、どういうこと？
translation: Huh? A chance? What do you mean, Nino?

japanese:
お父さんも心配してるんだから、
安心させてあげないと。
translation:
Our father is also worried,
so you have to reassure him.

japanese:
……そうだな。
ここで決めなきゃ、男がすたるってものか。
translation:
...I see. If I don't make a decision here,
my manliness is on the line.

japanese: あの、上杉さんまでどうしたんですか？
translation: Um, Uesugi-san, what's going on with you, even?

japanese: よく聞け、四葉！
translation: Listen carefully, Yotsuba!

japanese: は、はい！
translation: O-okay!

japanese:
これから、あの人に
俺たちが付き合っていることを報告し、
正式に交際を認めてもらう！
translation:
From now on, we will report to your dad
and officially acknowledge our relationship!

japanese:
ええっ！？
ええええええええええっ！？
translation:
WHAA%p-2;――%p;?!
WHAAAAAAAAAAAT?!

japanese: その言葉を待ってたよ、フータロー君。
translation: I was waiting for those words, Futaro-kun.

japanese:
お兄ちゃん、格好いい～！
恋愛ドラマみたい！
translation:
Big bro, you're so cool!
It's like a romance drama!

japanese: で、でも、そんなこと、いまここでしなくても！？
translation: But, but, do we have to do it here and now?!

japanese:
これも良い機会でしょう。
いずれは必要になることですから、
早いか遅いかの違いですよ。
translation:
This is also a good opportunity, isn't it?
It will eventually become necessary, so the only
difference is whether we do it sooner or later.

japanese:
ちょ、ちょっと！
なんでみんなもそんなに乗り気なの！？
translation:
H-hey!
Why is everyone so excited about this?!

japanese:
だ、だったら私から言います！
上杉さんはここで待っていてください！
translation:
Th-then I'll tell him myself!
Uesugi-san, please wait here!

japanese: 四葉、待ちなさい。
translation: Yotsuba, wait.

japanese: 二乃、止めないで～！
translation: Nino, don't stop me!

japanese: ダメ、行かせない。
translation: No. I won't let you go.

japanese: 三玖まで！？
translation: Even you, Miku?!

japanese: フータローを困らせるのは許さない。
translation: I won't let you do something to trouble Futaro.

japanese:
フー君がここまで言ってくれてるのよ？
あんた、嬉しくないわけ？
translation:
Fu-kun has come this far for us, right?
Aren't you happy?

japanese: そ、それはぁ……。
translation: Th-that's...

japanese: 四葉、俺に全部任せておけ。
translation: Yotsuba, leave everything to me.

japanese: 上杉さん……。
translation: Uesugi-san...

japanese: 四葉。
translation: Yotsuba.

japanese: 一花……。
translation: Ichika...

japanese:
わかりました。
よろしくお願いします。
translation:
I understand.
I'll leave it to you.

japanese: 恐らく反対されるだろうけどな。
translation: He'll probably be opposed to us though.

japanese:
あはは……。
ですよね。
translation: Ahaha... That's right.

japanese: ちょっと、ここで弱気になってどうするのよ。
translation: What the...? Don't get weak-kneed now.

japanese:
さっきの勢いはどこにいっちゃったの？
大丈夫かなぁ。
translation:
Where did your momentum go from earlier?
Are things really okay?

japanese:
でも、正面から無策でぶつかるのは
さすがに無謀なんじゃない？
なんたって相手は、あのお父さんだし。
translation:
But isn't it reckless to just charge in
without a plan and face him head on?
This is our dad we're talking about here.

japanese: まずは舞台を整えて、地の利を得ないと。
translation: We need to set the stage and gain the advantage.

japanese:
ああ、いったんホテルに戻って
作戦を立てるとするか。
translation:
Okay, let's go back to the hotel
and plan our strategy.

japanese:
任せとけ。
ここで怖じ気付くほど腰抜けじゃない。
translation:
I've got this.
I'm not so spineless as to back down now.

japanese:
私は、上杉さんを
そんな風に思ったことなんてありませんよ？
translation: I've never thought of you that way, Uesugi-san.

japanese:
自分で言ったことは必ずやり遂げる人だって、
知ってますから。
translation:
I know you're someone
who always follows through with what you say.

japanese:
でも、正面から無策でぶつかるのは
さすがに無謀なんじゃない？
なんたって相手は、あのお父さんだし。
translation:
But isn't it reckless to just charge in
without a plan and face him head on?
This is our dad we're talking about here.

japanese: まずは舞台を整えて、地の利を得ないと。
translation: We need to set the stage and gain the advantage.

japanese:
ああ、いったんホテルに戻って
作戦を立てるとするか。
translation:
Okay, let's go back to the hotel
and plan our strategy.

japanese: ただ事実を告げるだけだ。
translation: I just need to state the facts.

japanese:
お前の父親がどんな反応しようが、
俺とお前の関係に影響なんかない。
そうだろ？
translation:
Your father's reaction
won't have any impact on our relationship, will it?

japanese: えっ……。
translation: Wha...

japanese: お前は違うのか？
translation: You think differently?

japanese: いえ、上杉さんの言うとおりです。
translation: No, it's like you said, Uesugi-san.

japanese:
なかなか言うね。
いまのはちょっと、グッと来ちゃった。
translation:
You're pretty straightforward.
What you just said really had oomph.

japanese: ちゃ、茶化すなよ……。
translation: D-don't make fun of me....

japanese:
でも、正面から無策でぶつかるのは
さすがに無謀なんじゃない？
なんたって相手は、あのお父さんだし。
translation:
But isn't it reckless to just charge in
without a plan and face him head on?
This is our dad we're talking about here.

japanese: まずは舞台を整えて、地の利を得ないと。
translation: We need to set the stage and gain the advantage.

japanese:
ああ、いったんホテルに戻って
作戦を立てるとするか。
translation:
Okay, let's go back to the hotel
and plan our strategy.
